title: New configuration options for modules
Let's turn this into mx-tester 0.3.0
body: This is basically a bunch of fixes to adapt to several breakages caused by Synapse changes.

title: Update for clap 3.1
body: I removed the `use::clap` because it conflicts with our own `Command` struct

title: [Fix] Take down the network at the end of down()
body: This should reduce Docker hogging down resources *across reboots*.

title: Use Docker's autoretry instead of brute force manual retry
body: This simplifies the code and seems to work at least as well.

title: Attempt to retry when Synapse won't start.
body:
We are regularly faced with the following situations:

1. Synapse cannot open its port (even if we have just checked that the port is open)
   therefore it doesn't actually start; or
2. Synapse starts but stops immediately, having received a SIGTERM from origin
   unknown.

In both situations, mx-tester believes that Synapse has started but this is actually
incorrect.

With this change, we attempt to detect both cases. Once Docker claims that Synapse
has started, we attempt a few times to login to Synapse. If this fails, we conclude
that Synapse has stopped/never truly started and we attempt once again to start
Synapse.

title: [Fix] Module setup should take place *before* module copy & install.
Enable access to the host from the guest.
body: This should help with a number of tests that need to talk across guest/host borders.

title: Making tests pass on GitLab
body:
Took a few days of investigation, but the gist of it seems to be:

1. We need to put temporary files in `/builds/$CI_PROJECT_PATH/tmp` instead of `/tmp`.
2. We need to connect to the Docker registry, rather than trusting the daemon's default behavior.

title: Implement the equivalent of `docker login`.
body: Apparently, we need this feature to execute mx-tester as part of GitLab CI.

title: Version 0.2.2
Experimenting with GitHub Actions and docker
Tightening error handling.
Create a docker network for mx-tester.
body: We also give synapse the hostname `synapse` on this network.

title: Let's test that we can run `up`, `run`, `down`
body: Now that we have some CI, let's use it to at least check that I'm not breaking anything :)

title: Fix use of synapse root for container's data directory
We can now run e.g. mx-tester up run down up
body: I keep needing to write `mx-tester down up run` when testing Mjölnir and changing the config. With this patch, I can :)

title: Catching up on stuff that I landed on the wrong repo
